Crunching Function for XlsForm

Source: vignettes/crunching-function-for-xlsform.Rmd
crunching-function-for-xlsform.Rmd
library(kobocruncher)

Data examples to demo the package

Data loading 

datalist <- kobo_data(datapath = system.file("data.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher") )
# MainFrame
datalist[1]
#> [[1]]
#> # A tibble: 5 × 25
#>   today               date                location         profile.country
#>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <chr>            <chr>          
#> 1 2022-05-03 00:00:00 2022-04-21 00:00:00 private_facility VEN            
#> 2 2022-05-03 00:00:00 2022-05-03 00:00:00 home             HND            
#> 3 2022-05-03 00:00:00 2022-04-20 00:00:00 subcenter        SLV            
#> 4 2022-05-03 00:00:00 2022-05-02 00:00:00 subcenter        SLV            
#> 5 2022-05-03 00:00:00 2022-05-04 00:00:00 home             COL            
#> # … with 21 more variables: profile.occupation <chr>, profile.reason <chr>,
#> #   profile.reason.accomodation <dbl>, profile.reason.employment <dbl>,

Prepare data dictionnary 

dico <- kobo_dico( xlsformpath = system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher") )
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
# Survey
questions <- as.data.frame(dico[1])
knitr::kable(head(questions, 10))
type list_name name label hint repeatvar scope dataframe
today NA today NA NA 1
date NA date Interview date this is a hint 1
select_one location location Where is the interview taking place this is a hint 1
begin_group NA profile Respondant profile NA profile 1
select_one countries profile.country What is your country of Origin? this is a hint profile 1
text NA profile.occupation What’s you occupation? this is a hint profile 1
select_multiple reasons profile.reason Why did you left? this is a hint profile 1
integer NA profile.HHSize What’s the size of your household? this is a hint profile 1
end_group NA NA NA NA 1
begin_repeat NA members Please enter information for each family member NA members 2 
# Choices
responses <- as.data.frame(dico[2])
knitr::kable(head(responses, 10))
list_name name label
location home Home
location subcenter Community Center
location private_facility Private facility
sex male Male
sex female Female
countries COL Colombia
countries CUB Cuba
countries SLV El Salvador
countries GTM Guatemala
countries HND Honduras 
# Settings
metadata <- as.data.frame(dico[3])
knitr::kable(head(metadata, 10))
form_title form_id
Sample Dataset KoboloadeR koboloadeR

Get frame for a variable 

data <- kobo_frame(datapath = system.file("data.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"),
                   xlsformpath = system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"),
                   var = "members.sex"   )
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
knitr::kable(head(data,5))

Get the label for a specific variable 


label_varname(xlsformpath = system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              x ="profile.country")
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> [1] "What is your country of Origin?"

Get interpretation hint for a specific variable 

label_varhint(xlsformpath = system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              x ="profile.country")
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> [1] "this is a hint"

Get all the choices labels options for a specific variable 

label_choiceset(xlsformpath =  system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
                x="profile.country")
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#>   list_name name       label
#> 1 countries  COL    Colombia
#> 2 countries  CUB        Cuba
#> 3 countries  SLV El Salvador
#> 4 countries  GTM   Guatemala
#> 5 countries  HND    Honduras
#> 6 countries  NIC   Nicaragua
#> 7 countries  VEN   Venezuela

Get the label for a specific choice if available 

label_choice(xlsformpath =  system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              x = "profile.country")
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#>           COL           CUB           SLV           GTM           HND 
#>    "Colombia"        "Cuba" "El Salvador"   "Guatemala"    "Honduras" 
#>           NIC           VEN 
#>   "Nicaragua"   "Venezuela"

Plotting Select one variable 

plot_select_one(datapath = system.file("data.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"),
              xlsformpath =  system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              var = "profile.country")

Plotting Select one variable with Crosstabulation 

plot_select_one_cross(datapath = system.file("data.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"),
              xlsformpath =  system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              var = "profile.country",
              crosstab = "profile.occupation"
              )
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].

Output Header variable 

output_header( xlsformpath =  system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              var = "profile")
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4,
#> 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> ---
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> # Respondant profile

Crunching Variable based on type 

kobo_cruncher(datapath = system.file("data.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"),
              xlsformpath =  system.file("sample_xlsform.xlsx", package = "kobocruncher"), 
              type = "select_one", 
              name = "profile.country",
              showcode = TRUE)
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#>   `plot_select_one("profile.country")` 
#> 
#> 
#> Warning: Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].
#> Expected 2 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 9 rows [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13].

Report Template 1 for Automatic Data Exploration

The first RMD template gives an output in HTML for easy navigation - the left menu provides smooth transition.

It includes a function to automatically run throughout all the survey content. During this stage, data cleaning and new variable creation can be performed through iterations

This report also includes each plot syntax so that they can be easily pasted for the second report

Report Template 2 for Joint Data Interpretation Session

The second template is used following the systematic data exploration. It will generate a powerpoint presentation

See a more detailed presentation of that step here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0jE-Y7g88K4&feature=youtu.be&t=2305

Report Template 3 for Dissemination and Data Story Telling Template

The last template can be used to take note of the data interpretation session.

It will generate a PDF or an paginated HTML page

On this page

Developed by Edouard Legoupil, Hisham Galal.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.3.
